Those of you on the lookout for handy startup internships this summer, EDC IITR's Startup Internship Program might just be what you're after. 
In order to apply for the program, just mail your applications to internfair2012.iitr@gmail.com, with your _name_ and the _company applying for_ as the subject. 
Visit http://edciitr.com/events/intern_fair/2012/rules/ for further details. 
All the best!
FB Event page for the same: http://www.facebook.com/events/406019179427132/

data.message: Meanwhile, Vishal Battula (EE IV year) and MVR Murty (EE Dual V year) do IIT Roorkee proud by winning the prestigious Tata Crucible Business Quiz Chandigarh Regional finals. The duo will now have to go through another round of quizzing before they represent IIT Roorkee in the National finals to be held later this year.

data.message:
In a sad turn of affairs, Amey Mandhan, a IV year ECE student of IIT Roorkee, committed suicide in Allahabad yesterday, by jumping off the 4th floor of a building. 
May his soul rest in peace.
Dr. Ravi Kumar, who obtained his PhD in Drug Delivery from UoR in 2000, does pioneering work in the field of organ transplantation.
data.name: Nano drug delivery to eliminate transplant failures - The Times of India
data.caption: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
data.description: Sceintists are developing a nano-sized drug particle for organ transplant patients to eliminate its harmful side-effects, reveals a study.

data.message:
The first edition of Nav Umang turned out to be great success, with participation from all hostels from both campuses! The overall rankings are as follows:
1. Malviya Bhawan
2. Cautley Bhawan
3. Jawahar Bhawan

Detailed event winner lists will be released soon.

The Literary Section does IIT Roorkee proud! IITR was ranked 4th overall in Nihilant, the yearly quizzing fest purely for the IITs and IIMs! IIMA, IIML and IITK were ranked first, second and third respectively. Haaris Matein (IV Chem), Vishal Battula (IV EE) and Abhinav Malhotra (IV Chem) fended off tough competition from all the teams to win the Biz Quiz. In addition to this, IITR was the only team other than IIML and IIMA to qualify for the final round of all quizzes!

For whom the CAT bell tolls - 23 students from IITR score 99 and above percentiles in CAT '11. Here's a list of their names:
Vidish Iyer (Civil) - 100.00, 
MVR Murty (Elec. IDD) - 99.99,

Priya Chauhan (Elec) - 99.04.

Congratulations to all. 
And if we have left anyone out, do let us know!

Abhishek Rajput 99.4 ECE

data.description: The summers are always long. No matters how good a family you got, or how much money to spend; they do at some point or other start boring you. The point is everybody starts looking out for unconventional ways of killing time. I am 21, single, with no interest left in my education. I am miserable. T...

data.message: It was an error of oversight. I'm sorry. It has been corrected.

Sri Mangu Singh, a UoR alumnus, is to take over as the new Managing Director of Delhi Metro Rail Corporation from January 1, 2012 as E. Sreedharan, the 'Metro Man', finally hangs up his boots after serving as the Delhi Metro Chief for 15 years.
Sri Mangu has been serving as the Director (Works) DMRC since 2002.
congratulations to all. we are proud of being from UOR.

The Formula SAE car designed by the IIT-Roorkee team has successfully completed FSAE-Australasia 2011, an annual student motorcar design competition organized by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE International). Being the only Indian representation able to complete the competition, they surely have hit the big time. Congratulations!
47th Inter-IIT Sports Meet General Championship Tally.
Well done, Hope next year 1+1
@Anurag Paul: There was a slight mistake in the sheet prepared by the board which was rectified later... IITD girls are IVth.

Inter-IIT Sports Meet Final Update:

Badminton (Men): BRONZE.
IITR lost to IITK, 1-3. (Semifinal)
IITR defeated IITM, 3-1. (3rd place play offs)

Basketball (Women): GOLD.
IITR defeated IIT Kgp, 32-30. (Semifinal)
IITR defeated IITG, 46-30. (Final)

Cricket: 
IITR lost to IITD in the semifinals by 7 wickets. Batting first, IITR set IITD a target of 112 to chase in 20 overs, which they did comfortably. 

Hockey: BRONZE.
IITR lost to IITD, 3-5. (Semifinal)
IITR defeated IITB, 2-0. (3rd position play offs)

Squash: GOLD.
After defeating IITB 2-1 in the semis, the team went on to register an easy 2-1 win over IITM in the finals. 
The IITR contingent has done well to retain it's golden crown, and they've done it in style, without losing a single match in the entire tournament. Congratulations!

Table Tennis (Women): BRONZE.
IITR lost to IIT Kgp, 0-2. (Semifinal)
IITR defeated IITM, 2-1. (3rd position play off)

Tennis (Men): SILVER.
IITR defeated IITK, 2-0. (Semifinal)
IITR lost to a very formidable IITD side in the finals, 0-2, to take home some silver metal. An improvement over last year's fourth position - Well done, boys.

Tennis (Women): BRONZE.
R-girls bagged the bronze medal for the 2nd consecutive year, after defeating IITG 2-0 in the 3rd position play offs.

Volleyball (Men): GOLD.
IITR defeated IITD, 3-1. (Semifinal)
IITR defeated IIT Kgp, 3-2, in a very closely fought final match to emerge as champions and bring very significant 10 points home. Congrats, and very well done! 

Volleyball (Women): GOLD.
IITR defeated IITM, 3-1. (Semifinal)
IITR defeated IITK, 3-1 in the finals to win a historic first gold medal of the event. Introduced as a demo event in Inter-IIT this year, we hope the event goes mainstream very soon.
This is a very high point for IITR Volleyball, with both the teams (Men & Women) winning the gold medal this year. Kudos!

Football (Men): SILVER.
IITR defeated IITK, 1-0. (Semifinal)
IITR lost to IITD, 0-3. (Final)
With half of the team bedridden due to injuries, the football team has done remarkably well to finish as the runner up side. Turn it to Gold next year!

Athletics:
B.S.V. Sagar won the Silver in the 400m (Men) event, clocking 53:20s against Veer Singh's (IITK) 53s who won the gold; and Bronze in the 400m hurdles (Men) event, clocking 01:02:20min. against Siva Teja V.'s (IITM) 01:01:10min. who won the gold. 
Manoj Kumar Meena won the Bronze in 500m (Men) event, finishing with a timing of 17:41:90min against Kailash Bishnoi's (IITB) 17:35:80min. who won the Gold.
IITR won the Gold in the 4X100m relay (Women) race, clocking 01:00:80min.
Nishigandha Sakhardande (14:80s) won the Gold, and Shivani Gupta (15:20s) won the Bronze in the 100m (Women) event.
Nishigandha Sakhardande also won the Bronze in 200m (Women) event, clocking 32:30s. 
The IITR ladies finished with a tally of 3 Gold, 1 Silver and 3 Bronze event medals, coming first in the Athletics GC.

Overall Championship (Girls): With golds in Swimming, Athletics and Basketball, IIT Roorkee finished first for the second consecutive year, with total 45.5 points. IIT Kgp came a not-so-distant second with 42.03 points in total.

Overall Championship (Boys): IITM won the overall GC for the 2nd consecutive time, with total 73.63 points - just lucky enough to be more than IITB's total of 73.13 who finished 2nd. Although we slipped one position down over last year, to 3rd with 53.5 points in total, there were many positives to look up to throughout the tournament.

The Adidas kits, air-fare perks and such did seem to work in favor of our Inter-IIT athletes after all, with both the Men and Women contingents bringing reasonable glory back home. 
Here's wishing the next year's Inter-IIT aspirants - all the best!

Kerala Govt. signs MoU with IIT Roorkee, to study the tremor intensity and conduct a dam-break analysis on the Mullaperiyar Dam:
http://www.newstrackindia.com/newsdetails/253750
http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/cities/kochi/iit-team-study-tremor-intensity-611

Inter-IIT Sports Meet Day-7 Update:

Badminton (Men):
IIT-R defeated IIT-Ropar, 3-0. (Quarterfinal Stage)

Basketball (Men):
IIT-R lost to IIT-B, 37-49. (Quarterfinal Stage)

Basketball (Women):
IIT-R thrashed IIT-B, 48-32. (Quarterfinal Stage)
The team has shown the ability to perform in crucial moments (against IIT-G in the groups stage), and has stayed unbeaten in the tournament so far. There's no reason why they shouldn't be eyeing the Gold this year.

Table Tennis (Men):
IIT-R lost to IIT-D, 1-3. (Quarterfinal Stage)

Table Tennis (Women):
IIT-R defeated IIT-G, 2-0. (Quarterfinal Stage)

Cricket:
IIT-R (103/3) defeated IIT-Mandi (102). (Quarterfinal Stage)
The team looks in good shape and stays unbeaten in the tournament, seems to be in a good position to reach the finals.

Football:
IIT-R dominated most of the later first half and the entire second half of their quarterfinal match against IIT-B, but failed to convert crucial opportunities into goals. The 0-0 score line after extra time saw the two sides going for penalty shoot outs, where brilliant goalkeeping helped IIT-R register a 3-1 win over IIT-B. 
Revenge is a dish, best served with a foot - R-men had lost in the Inter-IIT finals last year to B-men, in penalty shoot outs.

Hockey:
IIT-R lost to IIT-K, 0-1. (Quarterfinal Stage)

Tennis (Men):
IIT-R defeated IIT-G, 2-0. (Quarterfinal Stage)

Volleyball (Men):
IIT-R defeated IIT-G, 3-0. (Quarterfinal Stage)

Volleyball (Women):
IIT-R defeated IIT-Kgp, 2-0. (Quarterfinal Stage)
IIT Ropar ? :D

Inter-IIT Sports Meet Day-6 Update:

Athletics:
1) IITR clean sweeps the Long Jump (Women) Finals. Nishigandha Sakhardande (4.05m) bagged the gold medal, Shivani Gupta (4.03m) bagged the silver medal and Pragati Choudhary (3.97m) finished third.
2) The IITR (Women 4X100m) relay team and B.S.V. Sagar (Men 200m) have qualified for the final run.

Badminton (Women):
IIT-R defeated IIT-Indore, 2-0.

Football:
In wake of injuries and crucial goal misses, IIT-R suffered a last minute 1-0 defeat at the foots of IIT-Hyd team in a Groups Stage game, what can be sited as one of the biggest upset of this year's Sports Meet so far.

Hockey:
IIT-R defeated IIT-Guwahati, 2-0. (Group Stage)

Squash:
IIT-R thrashed IIT-K, 3-0. (Group Stage)

Table Tennis (Men):
IIT-R lost to IIT-M, 0-3. (Group Stage)

Tennis (Men):
IIT-R defeated IIT-Ropar, 2-0. (Group Stage)

Tennis (Women):
IIT-R lost to IIT-Kgp, 0-2. (Group Stage)

Volleyball (Women):
IIT-R defeated IIT-Indore, 2-0. (Group Stage)
